If ever I persuade anyone of anything, let it be that they should play this game. 
My all time favourite game. 
Amazing concept, amazing story, amazing gameplay! 
And if you're thinking that once you finish the game it's over? Not true!
Personally I can replay this game over and over, but if that's not you then there are thousands of community maps to play too!
Obviously they're not all good... But there are some real gems there! 
Let's not forget the co-op campaign which, you guessed it, also has community maps to play! 
Honestly, I absolutely love this game and I'm fairly difficult to impress... So... 
Definitely recommended.

Un très bon jeu que je recommande, si vous aimez les casse-têtes. Ce jeu est en fait une succession de casse-têtes basés sur les portails et d'autres effet physique (rayon pousseur-tirreur, mur de lumière, laser et lentille, tourelle, fluides...). Le tout sur un fond d'histoire vraiment sympa et de dialogues hillarants. L'ambience est terrible. J'ai eu besoin de 6 heures de jeu sans soluce pour en venir à bout. J'en garderais un très bon souvenir !
Great game, great story. Just play it!

Look a review with no cake or friendship cube reference….dang it.

At first, I was a little wary about this game. Starting this game right after it's predecessor, I thought it was just going to be the same thing: GLaDOS giving you tests to go through. As I went along, it kept on surprising me with new gameplay mechanics and plot twists so I never got bored. In fact, this game got addicting. I constantly was playing this game in my free time so I could see what Valve would throw at me next. Upon beating the game (and its multiplayer campaign), I ventured forth into the community maps. I must say, the communtiy for this game is a very intelligent one, as I came across levels that made me wonder if I was playing a level pack made by Valve! The community maps are accompanied by Cave Johnson's glorious writing that never fails to make me laugh. I reccomend playing the community maps after the main game, though, as some of these maps continue the end game's difficulty. Overall, this game is VERY well constructed and has content that makes you want to keep coming back. I give this game a 10/10. Everything is perfect: from the intelligent writing to the creative and clever puzzles. Even if puzzle games are not your genre of preference, I stress you to at least try it. I promise you won't be disappointed.

NOW we're thinking with portals.

Portal 2 is a sequel to the game Portal. Unlike many sequels, this game is superior to the first game. Singleplayer is puzzeling and the diolouge is hilarious. New to Portal 2 is the multiplayer, which is a welcome addition. Exclusive to Steam is the puzzle builder. You can create your own test chambers and share them with the world. I highly reccomend this game to everybody.

10/10 just buy it

Portal 2 is now my favourite puzzle game evar! The chracters dialogues were amazing, the plot was understandable and the game play was fantastic. The game is also not too easy and not too hard. The game is also not too long and not too short. The co-op was incredable! Having to play with 2 players was a blast! And the final boss was very creative! Having to use all your skills that you have learnt from the game to fight the final boss was very imaginative!

If you don't know what I'm saying... Buy the damn game!

If you still don't... Then if think you have to consult with a doctor.

This is one of the best rated games on Steam for a reason. While challenging at times, the storyline is so brilliant that you are driven to keep finding the answer to that next puzzle to see what happens. The voice-over cast is second to none.  10/10


Pros:
+ Hillarious and Entertaining Storyline
+ Phenomenal Voice Acting
+ Challenging but not impossible puzzles
+ Enormous amount of ingame content outside of single player

Cons:
- A key part of the storyline can be missed if you aren't paying attention. I had to read a Wiki Plot Review at one point because I realized I had missed something intregal to the story.
- Final boss is fairly easy compared to the first Portal

Gráficamente muy bonito, me encantó como se profundizó en la historia de GLaDOS, y los pequeños guiños a Black Mesa y un salvavidas con el nombre del Borealis.. Dios santo, quiero Half-Life 3.
Muy entretenido también el cooperativo, y sacar sus logros no es nada del otro mundo (salvo 1 o 2 del Co-Op, si que me/nos llegaron a costar UN POQUITO.
En general los juegos de puzzle no me suelen gustar porque tengo un serio problema, que es complicarlos un 200% más de lo que en realidad son, y tardo el triple por intentar hacer estupideces complejas que para nada tienen que ver con la verdadera forma de resolver el puzzle... Pero fué un lindo reto personal (La primera vez que lo jugé fué pirata, así que ahora no me costó tanto como la primera vez, pero igual me habré quedado atascado unos 10 minutos en 2 o 3 cámaras).

La segunda parte de este gran juego...
Es lo mismo que la primera entrega pero mas divertido, dicen que las segundas partes siempre son peores? Pues esta es una excepcion, en lo personal me gusto mucho mas este que el 1.

10/10, Obra maestra

One of the most unique games of this generation. The singleplayer story is wonderful, the characters are lovable, the puzzles are challenging, the graphics are great, and the multiplayer is awesome. 

Can't think of something that brings this game down. It is just amazing.

In a very pleasent surprise, this game didn't turn out to be just a longer version of the original Portal game.  I thought it would be difficult for Valve to create a sequel to the first without making it so similar that it seemed like the extended edition of Portal 1, but they stepped up to the plate and did very well for themselves.  Just from the first few minutes of gameplay you can already tell that the second installment in the Portal franchise has a meatier story with interesting characters and still brings it's signature humour from the orignal title.  GLaDOS is still a very important part of the story and is involved in a very special moment involving a 9 volt battery and a potato.  You also still play as the female protagonist in this installment.  The stunning attention to detail in the level design and the atmosphere is phenomenal and really struts Valve's stuff.

Portal 2 expands on the standard portal gun gameplay from the original while adding these fun new mechanics called gels, but I'll let you find out more about those buggers.  The puzzles this time around aren't easy, but they're all reasonable and don't seem to require Stephen Hawking to decypher.

As great as everyone knows the Portal storyline is, the co-operative feature added to this Portal really makes it stand out.  Grab a friend and take your shot at some co-operative humour-based puzzle fun to see who's the worse at navigating a light bridge!  

Overall the only real downside I see is that once you've finished the single player and the co-operative modes, there isn't much replayability here, especially considering I don't know anyone who really delves into the map editor feature and all, but it is certainly worth the 15 or more hours of fun regardless.

A solid 10/10, would potato again.

I just love it. The puzzles are challenging, the gameplay is fantastic, the music is good as ever, the characters are endearing, the writing and humor are effective, and Steve Merchant and Ellen McClain in their respective roles are fantastic. The first one was great at the cost of being a tad short, but this one is twice as long and twice as fun. Definitely recommended, especially for fans of the first.
